alert.note: Alert for Coosa; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Tallapoosa and northeastern Coosa Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 742 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Goodwater, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alexander City, Dadeville, Goodwater, Camp Hill, Kellyton, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Waverly, Hanover, Bradford, Hatchet, Hillabee Creek, Eastern Lake Martin, Northern Lake Martin, Wind Creek State Park, Still Waters Resort, Southern Lake Martin, Fishpond, Ray and Hackneyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
